name: Crystal Pools
description:
Introduction

This canyon is described in limited detail in Canyons Near Sydney by Rick Jamieson. Help the Australian canyoning community by contributing track notes to ropewiki.com

Crysal Pools isn't much of a canyon but the pools are nice if they are not full of sand, which they often are. A couple of abseils up to 10m in an open canyon.

The approach and exit do give great views over Bungleboori pagoda country

At the time of wirting a descent 4wd and some skill will get you to the fire trail that runs along the ridge top to the north of the canyon (the southern fire trial gets you closer to the start but is more difficult to exit to)

Park at MGA452978

Approach

From the car head down the big open gully to the south. There is a bit of rock scrambling at the bottom but the creek is soon reached and the "canyon" starts just down stream

Descent

The "Canyon" starts as a little V shaped gully with a rocky bottom.

There are some down climbs. Don't be temped to slide the one that looks slidable. it's not.

P1. 7m First abseil is from a large log handing over the waterfall P2. 5m from a rock wedged in the creek. if the pool is clear it is jumpable but in 2023 this pool was full of sand and the water ankle deep. p3. 10m theres not much to anchor off in ther creek. A somewhat dubious traverse along a ledge canyon left gets you to an anchor around a rock pillar which gives a dirty abseil down to the final hallway

Exit

Dont go all the way to the Bungleboori, exit to the left either before or 100m after the last drop.

Red tape

Road access likely to be lost in the reconcilliation of maintained roads in the Gardens of Stone Conservation area
